newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt bars genetically modified grain/soy imports.
newsitem.headline: Egypt bars genetically modified grain/soy imports.

text.p: Egypt's Ministry of Health has decreed that imported grains and pulses meant for human consumption must be accompanied by a certificate which proves that genetic engineering was not used in their production.

A copy of the decree, dated July 1, was sent to local traders this week and obtained by Reuters on Thursday. It says: "It is not approved to import foodstuffs which have used genetic engineering in their production, until they are proven fit for consumption."
"Imported grains and pulses must be accompanied by a certificate from the country of origin saying that they have not been harvested or produced using genetic engineering."
Officials at the ministry of health could not be immediately reached for comment on Thursday, a national holiday.
The decree said Egyptian ports of entry would be notified of the rules, which it said must be published in local newspapers.
The implementation date was not immediately clear.
